Name: Audio/Visual Volunteer
Position Description:
As an Audio/Visual Volunteer, you help make RIM's programs accessible to both in-person and virtual community members so that everyone can learn and practice together. Audio/Visual Volunteers manage the cameras and microphones in the meditation hall and ensure that Zoom video and audio are accessible to all participants.

Responsibilities

The Audio/Visual equipment and procedures have been implemented to be easy to learn and manage. You will be trained to:

  • Arrive 30 minutes before the relevant offering
  • Turn on and off equipment before and after each session
  • Check and ensure all equipment and software is ready for use
  • Control camera views and sound through easy to use software and buttons
  • Perform troubleshooting and problem resolution with software and equipment when needed
  • Help community members use equipment

Skills, Experience, and Qualities

The Audio/Visual Volunteer position has been designed to be easily fulfilled by anyone who goes through a short training session. The following skills, experience, and qualities are necessary for this role.

  • Basic comfort with computers and equipment
  • Able to perform simple troubleshooting and problem resolution
  • Able to commit to the role and be punctual
  • Comfort helping others
  • Willingness to learn
  • A friendly, supportive, and non-judgmental attitude
  • Openness to learning about stewardship and make it an embodied personal practice while volunteering
  • Able and willing to collaborate with others for the benefit of the entire RIM community

Commitment

  • Term: at least 6 months
  • Time Commitment: As needed for chosen offering

Special Notes

Audio/Visual Volunteers play an essential role at RIM. Your participation allows RIM to operate as a hybrid center, where members can participate in person and through Zoom. You will be part of a larger team of Audio/Visual Volunteers, each committing to one or more program offerings.
Current Volunteers: amy-gardner; christine-jacobi; mohammed-nubhasha; silvia-pasquini; monty; nancy-lakam; salomao-doria-jorge

Name: Fall Retreat Help: Tech Support
Position Description:
Are you attending the Fall Retreat at The Christine Center? We could use your help with tech support.

Needs and Requirements

  • Sets up and manages Audio System during the retreat.
  • Good Understanding of Audio Equipment is needed - will train volunteer on the RIM system.
  • Please arrive at The Christine Center at 1:30pm so that there is time to set up the sound equipment.

Notes

Your help is appreciated. Please fill out the form below to let us know that you are interested in helping with tech support.

Name: Good Evening Meditation Community Guide
Position Description:
Community Guides provide the Rooted in Mindfulness Community with opportunities for daily meditation practice together. Practice sessions are held mostly in silence each morning and evening for 30 minutes.

Responsibilities

  • Logging in to RIM zoom account
  • Reading meditation script provided by Guiding Teacher
  • Logging out of RIM zoom account
  • Meeting with the whole group of Community Guides on a quarterly basis

Position Requirements

  • Dedicated to a regular meditation practice for at least 1 year
  • Understands the Vision and Mission of RIM
  • Experience guiding meditations or willingness to learn
  • Cares for the cultivation and growth of a diverse meditation community

Community Connections

  • Checks in with: GM/GE Meditation Coordinator
  • Team Members: Other GM/GE Community Guides

Anticipated Time Commitment and Involvement

  • Position Term: 6 Months
  • Time commitment: 30 minutes per week
  • Location: Practice is guided from your own home via zoom
Current Volunteers: jessica-chapin; christine-jacobi; marcelo-pasquini; annie-repaci; cindy-shicotte; jamie-smidt; sara-neall; thomas-windsor; deepak-sharma

Name: Good Morning/Good Evening Meditation Coordinator
Position Description:
The GM/GE Meditation Coordinator will ensure Community Guides are supported with training and scheduling of daily morning and evening virtual meditation sessions.  

Responsibilities

  • Coordinate and organize the general logistics of the GM/GE Meditation program.
  • Manage the Morning and Evening meditation schedule, finding substitutes when needed.
  • Elicit new community volunteers to guide the sessions when needed.
  • Collaborate with Guiding Teacher and Community Guides to onboard new volunteers.
  • Collaborate with Guiding Teacher and Community Guides to support and ensure the intentions of the sessions remain aligned with RIM’s mission and vision.
  • Organize and facilitate quarterly meetings with Community Guides to create a sense of group cohesion and exchange ideas and experiences.

Skills, Experience, and Qualities

  • Invested in cultivating and growing a healthy and diverse RIM community
  • Sensitive to working with people with diverse backgrounds
  • Able to model mindful listening and speaking
  • Able to collaborate well with others
  • Proficient verbal and written communication skills
  • Comfortable with basic computer skills and willingness to learn

Team Collaboration

  • The GM/GE Coordinator is supported by the Guiding Teacher and the Board of Directors. In order to fulfill their responsibilities, the Coordinator may collaborate with the following team members: Support team, Volunteer Coordinator, Newsletter, and other RIM volunteers.

Anticipated Time Commitment and Involvement

  • Position Term: 1 year
  • Time commitment: Varies - When scheduling, average 1 hour per week. Quarterly 1 hour check-ins with Guiding Teacher and Guides. Periodic emails to ensure schedule stability.  ‍
  • Location: Flexible - Rooted In Mindfulness, Zoom, Home.

Name: Greeter
Position Description:
As a Greeter volunteer, you help fellow community members and visitors feel welcome, safe, comfortable and supported at RIM's in-person offerings. Greeters also help prepare the meditation and community room spaces to create a clean and supportive environment. Most offerings will have a team of two greeters/openers.

Responsibilities

  • Opens and readies the community room and meditation hall for community participants.
  • Welcomes current members and visitors as they arrive to the Center.
  • Offers direction for new people to the Meditation and Community Rooms, restrooms, tea & snack area, library, information area, etc.
  • Answers any questions and concerns related to RIM, its offerings, practice of dana, etc.
  • Helps support those with specific needs, i.e., listening devices, seating, etc.

Skills, Experience, and Qualities

  • Commit to arrive at least 30 minutes before a class or event and remain 15 minutes after the close of the session.
  • A friendly, supportive, and non-judgmental attitude.
  • Sensitivity to the needs of each person and ability to modulate your interactions accordingly to create a welcoming, safe, and comfortable experience for all.
  • Openness to learning about stewardship and make it an embodied personal practice while volunteering.
  • Openness to learning how to help participants understand and embody the shared values and best practices related to learning and practicing as a community.
  • Able and willing to collaborate with others for the benefit of the entire RIM community.

Commitment

  • Term: at least 6 months
  • Time Commitment: As needed for chosen offering
Current Volunteers: amy-gardner; annie-repaci; chawki-belhadi; cindy-shicotte; kerry-thomas; lorilee-villwock; marne-taylor; wendy-peche; mike-ferguson

Name: Housekeeping
Position Description:
Help maintain and ensure the warmth, beauty and peacefulness of the Center’s physical space. Housekeeping maintains cleanliness and neatness of the Meditation Room, Community Room, and Admin Office on a weekly basis as a generous service to the entire community.

Responsibilities

  • Vacuuming and dusting Community Room & Admin Office
  • Cleaning surfaces & Tidying up Tea area
  • Vacuuming, mopping & dusting Meditation Room
  • Emptying garbage in the Center where needed
  • Setting up the Meditation Room for the next occurring class on the RIM Calendar

Position Requirements

  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to lift and move large and small meditation cushions and chairs
  • Able to take direction
  • Finds joy in performing tasks essential to co-create the Center’s beauty

Community Connections

  • Checks-in with: Volunteer Coordinator
  • Related to: Room Set-Up, RIM Calendar

Anticipated Time Commitment and Involvement

  • Position Term: 6 months
  • Time commitment: 1.5 hour a week, 4 times per month (divided by team members)
  • Suggested  cleaning days: Ideally prior to drop-ins (Monday, Tuesday or Saturdays, but can be flexible to accommodate volunteer’s availability)
  • ‍Location: At Rooted In Mindfulness

Name: Kalyana Mitta Group Coordinator
Position Description:
Kalyana Mitta (spiritual friends) groups allow RIM community members to connect with others in a safe, friendly, and supportive setting. These groups support learning, practice and complement all other programs at RIM.

The Kalyana Mitta Group Coordinator helps fellow community members navigate the process to bring a KM group to life. The coordinator supports facilitators as they get started, become established, and fulfill the group's intentions while remaining aligned with RIM's mission and vision.

Responsibilities

  • Steward the meaning and purpose of Kalyana Mitta Groups;
  • Manage and support members who are submitting KM Group applications;
  • Collaborate with Guiding Teacher and other involved members to review KM group applications;
  • Coordinate, organize, and manage the general logistics of the KM program.

Skills, Experience, and Qualities

  • Ability to work independently, set up priorities, and follow-through
  • Sensitive to working with people with diverse backgrounds
  • Able to collaborate well with others
  • Willing to support and empower community members
  • Proficient verbal and written communication skills
  • Comfortable with basic computer skills and willingness to learn

Commitment

  • Term: At least 1 year
  • Time Commitment: Typically 1-2 hours / week

Name: Librarian
Position Description:
Help fellow community members deepen their learning and practice with supportive books, magazines, and other resources. The RIM Library is a resource for the community, given by the generosity of the community. The Librarian manages and organizes the Rooted in Mindfulness Lending Library for the community.

Responsibilities

  • Maintaining the organization of books in alphabetical order by author
  • Managing donated Dharma and/or Mindfulness based books by placing RIM Label inside cover and shelving
  • Placing donated books that are not directly related to Mindfulness/Meditation/Dharma in “To Be Reviewed” basket in the Community Room office for Guiding Teacher approval
  • Reshelving returned books
  • Cares for the presentation and cleanliness of the Library shelves

Skills, Experience, and Qualities

  • Interested in organization and attention to detail
  • Interest in supporting the growth of knowledge for RIM Community

Team Collaboration

  • Checks in with: Board of Directors, Guiding Teacher

Anticipated Time Commitment and Involvement

  • Position Term: At least one-year commitment
  • Time commitment: Approximately 1 hour per week
  • ‍Location: At Rooted in Mindfulness

Name: Plant Caretaker
Position Description:
Help take care of the plants that beautify and foster well-being to RIM’s shared space.The plant caretaker is responsible for tending to all the plants and flowers that adorn our center. Creating the conditions for our plants to thrive can be a beneficial part of a mindfulness practice.

Responsibilities

  • Water plants on a weekly basis (as needed)
  • Trim and re-pot plants when needed
  • Clean up and discard any debris around plants
  • Care for any vases of fresh flowers at the center; provide fresh water, fresh cut stems, discard flowers no longer blooming, clean vases  
  • Communicate need for supplies and new plants

Skills, Experience, and Qualities

  • Knowledgeable about indoor plants and/or willingness to learn
  • Willingness to travel to RIM approximately 1 time per week

Team Collaboration

  • This position may be shared by 2 volunteers.

Anticipated Time Commitment and Involvement

  • Position Term: Minimum of 1 year commitment
  • Time commitment: Approximately 1 hour per week
  • Location: At Rooted In Mindfulness

Name: Retreat Help: Greeter
Position Description:
Are you attending a Retreat or Day of Mindfulness? We could use your help welcoming and directing participants at the retreat location.

‍

As a Retreat Greeter volunteer, you help fellow retreat participants feel welcome, safe, comfortable and supported at RIM's retreat offerings.

Responsibilities

  • Welcomes retreat participants as they arrive at the retreat location.
  • Offers direction for participants to the retreat check-in table, restrooms, tea & snack area, among other relevant information.
  • Answers any questions and concerns related to retreat - or direct participant to appropriate information channel

Skills, Experience, and Qualities

  • Commit to arrive at least 45 minutes before the retreat start time
  • A friendly, supportive, and non-judgmental attitude.
  • Sensitivity to the needs of each person and ability to modulate your interactions accordingly to create a welcoming, safe, and comfortable experience for all.
  • Openness to learning about stewardship and make it an embodied personal practice while volunteering.

Name: Retreat Help: Meditation Room Break-Down After the Retreat
Position Description:
Are you attending a Day of Mindfulness or Retreat? We could use your help breaking-down the meditation room after the retreat.

Needs and Requirements

  • Pack up supplies in the meditation room and help load them into volunteers' vehicles to bring back to RIM.

Notes

Your help is appreciated. Please fill out the form below to let us know that you are interested in helping out with breaking-down the meditation room after the retreat.

Name: Retreat Help: Meditation Room Set-up
Position Description:
Are you attending a Retreat or Day of Mindfulness? We could use your help unloading supplies from vehicles and setting-up the meditation room at the retreat venue.

Needs and Requirements

  • Move supplies from volunteer vehicles to the meditation room at retreat location
  • Help setup the meditation room by arranging the chairs and cushions. A RIM volunteer will be there to give guidance.
  • Please be at retreat location at least 90 minutes prior to program start time.

Notes

Your help is appreciated. Please fill out the form below to let us know that you are interested in helping out with Mediation Room Set-up.

Name: Retreat Help: Prep and Pack
Position Description:
Are you attending a Retreat or Day of Mindfulness? We could use your help preparing and packing retreat supplies.

Needs and Requirements

  • Prep and pack supplies into containers on designated day and time - usually the day before program start date
  • Along with other volunteers, lift and transfer supplies in containers from RIM to transporting vehicles. Please be sure that you are comfortable enough to help with this activity.
  • Please arrive at designated retreat location 90 minutes prior to program start time, so there is time to unpack and set up the meditation room for the retreat.

Notes

Your help is appreciated. Please fill out the form below to let us know that you are interested in helping prepare and pack retreat supplies.

Name: Retreat Help: Transporting Supplies Back to RIM
Position Description:
Are you attending a Retreat or Day of Mindfulness? We could use your help transporting supplies from the retreat venue back to RIM.

Needs and Requirements

  • Load and Transport supplies and equipment to RIM immediately after the retreat is over.
  • Carry supply containers up to RIM.

Notes

Your help is appreciated. Please fill out the form below to let us know that you are interested in helping out with Transporting Supplies back to RIM after the retreat.

Name: Retreat Help: Transporting Supplies to Retreat
Position Description:
Are you attending a Retreat or Day of Mindfulness? We could use your help transporting supplies from RIM to retreat venue.

Needs and Requirements

  • Be at RIM on designated day and time (usually a day prior to retreat) to help transport supplies and equipment to retreat location. The supplies will be ready for you and other volunteers will help load into your vehicle.
  • You will need to lift and transfer supply containers from RIM to your vehicles and then unload at retreat location. Please be sure that you are comfortable enough to help with this activity.
  • Please arrive at retreat location at least 90 minutes prior to program start time, so we have time to set up the meditation room for the retreat.

Notes

Your help is appreciated. Please fill out the form below to let us know that you are interested in helping out with Transporting Supplies to Retreat.

Name: Zoom Host
Position Description:
Help make RIM's virtual offerings welcoming, safe, and supportive for RIM community members. As a Zoom Host Volunteer, you will open the virtual space, greet participants, and help ensure a healthy community environment for learning, practice, and fellowship.

Most offerings have a team of two hosts (host and co-host) to support one another and the participants.

Responsibilities

  • Open Zoom Sessions 15 minutes prior to program start.
  • Greet and make all Community members participating via Zoom feel welcome and cared for.
  • Embody and promote best practices related to stewardship; i.e., co-creating a healthy and supportive space where all feel safe, supported, and able to learn and practice together.
  • Look after and help participants with video, audio, and chat.

Skills, Experience, and Qualities

  • Access to and comfort with computers and Zoom technology.
  • A friendly, supportive, and non-judgmental attitude.
  • Openness to learning about stewardship and make it an embodied personal practice while volunteering.
  • Openness to learning how to help participants understand and embody the shared values and best practices related to learning and practicing as a community.
  • Able and willing to collaborate with others for the benefit of the entire RIM community.

Commitment

  • Term: At least 6 months
  • Time Commitment: Typically 1 or more programs each week
Current Volunteers: amy-gardner; annie-repaci; daniel-frieberg; daniela-oliveira; jim-voelz; monty; nancy-lakam; patricia-jensen; silvia-pasquini; stacey-isaacson
